attributes.action: Debate bringing in 100% Mortgages for long term renters.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of the UK’s population have more than enough income to afford a mortgage but don’t have the disposable income if they are also having to pay rent.

This would make a massive difference to get people on the ladder and also aid the house buying market in the UK.

It’s a very simple concept, how do you expect someone to save £500 a month towards a deposit if they are also already forking out their wages on rent. 🤷‍♂️
attributes.background:
Where someone has been renting for a minimum period of 24 months continuous, the rent paid should be considered satisfactory proof of affordability for a mortgage with 0 deposit.  

Example: Someone paying £750 per month for that period, should be able to get a mortgage at the same monthly rate.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for lenders and not the UK Government or Parliament
